alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 12 at 9:30PM CDT until April 12 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR WESTERN MITCHELL COUNTY... At 930 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Osage, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Mitchell County, including the following locations... Osage Spring Park and Mitchell. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
